qas.question: Where did France try to invade in 1898?
What army did Britain and Egypt defeat together?
When did Britain withdraw from Sudan?
What was the period of European empires competing to control Africa called?
Where was a conference held in 1884 to regulate European competition for Africa?

context: With French, Belgian and Portuguese activity in the lower Congo River region undermining orderly incursion of tropical Africa, the <a4_0>Berlin<a4_0/> Conference of 1884–85 was held to regulate the competition between the European powers in what was called <a3_0>the "Scramble for Africa"<a3_0/> by defining "effective occupation" as the criterion for international recognition of territorial claims. The scramble continued into the 1890s, and caused Britain to reconsider its decision in <a2_0>1885<a2_0/> to withdraw from Sudan. A joint force of British and Egyptian troops defeated the <a1_0>Mahdist<a1_0/> Army in 1896, and rebuffed a French attempted invasion at <a0_0>Fashoda<a0_0/> in 1898. Sudan was nominally made an Anglo-Egyptian Condominium, but a British colony in reality.
